reviews.text:
Brillant Hotel, real up market hotel. Service and staff were excellent and really helpful. Spa, swimming was amazing, and views of the city with sunset were amazing.
The buffet was excellent for €28 euros and such a wide range of food.
We had a convention at the hotel, which was a great location and venue.
I didn't stay at hotel so I can't review this.

The hotel was amazing and so was its location. The only downfall was we were staying on the 8th floor so we heard the rooftop restaurant during the night and it was very noisy. Other than that we loved our stay at this hotel. It was a short walk to a lot of sites, as well as the ferry to Valletta. We would definitely stay here again!

Rooms are clean, large and comfortable, service is fantastic, beautiful hotel.

Of the restaurants, the Rooftop Bar was the best for dinner- they were outstanding service, drinks and food.  The Temptasian restaurant was not quite the atmosphere described - food was good but they seated us at a table right near the kitchen without good ventilation and made it feel like a sauna then a restaurant.

Breakfast was delicious and well worth while with great gluten free options.

Overall, a great hotel and would definitely recommend.

Had a really good stay at this hotel. The staff are really nice and friendly and work hard to make your holiday good. We stayed in the fragrance suite which was lovely and spacious although I think more hanging space would be good. I knocked one star off as it's starting to look a bit tired and could do with some tlc. The location was good but up a bit of an incline.

Lovely hotel with excellent facilities. Lovely large rooms with balconies, mini fridge and great amenities in the bathroom. Good service at all bars and friendly staff throughout. My only suggestion would be on the Saturday grill night. The photos promoting this event portray a grill with an amazing looking cut of meat. The reality is that it’s a buffet and all the meats are in heated chargers, coated in various marinades. I found the meats to be over flavoured and overcooked. At nearly €50 per head I didn’t consider this value for money.
